lcn.p: Mindfulness is a habit that must be cultivated.

Use a Mindfulness Bell that chimes, neither too predictably nor too erratically, as a tool to help keep on track with your mindfulness training. When you hear it chime, stop, and center yourself on the here-and-now.

The actual physical stopping and taking of three breaths upon hearing the Mindfulness Bell chime - a practice customary among Zen Buddhists - can be useful. The heart of the practice is in how you are more fully centered on the here-and-now afterwards, once you go on with what you are doing - but the physical stopping and taking of three breaths can aid your habit of doing so in a variety of ways.
